title: The Parental Alienation Syndrome: A Guide for Mental Health and Legal Professionals
description: This is the definitive work on a phenomenon which seems to afflict, to one degree or another, most divorcing fathers, and through which, for the rest of their lives, victimized fathers and their children suffer profoundly. The book diagnoses the problem, and provides insights into its causes and possible avoidance.
author: Richard A. Gardner
